Result.Abstract: We prove some convergence properties for a class of ant colony optimization algorithms. In this paper we present and discuss an application of ACO to Constraint Satisfaction Problems (CSPs).
Result.Title: ACO for Maximal Constraint Satisfaction Problems

Result.Abstract: This paper addresses the cooperative transport of a heavy object, called prey, towards a sporadically changing target location by a group of robots. The study is focused on the situation in which some robots are given the opportunity to localize the target, while the others (called the blind ones) are not. We propose the use of relatively simple robots capable
Result.Title: Group Transport of an Object to a Target That Only Some Group Members May Sense

Result.Abstract: The Probabilistic Traveling Salesman Problem (PTSP) is a TSP problem in which each customer has a given probability of requiring a visit. The goal is to nd an a priori tour of minimal expected length over all customers, with the strategy of visiting a random subset of customers in the same order as they appear in the a priori tour.
Result.Title: Solving the Homogeneous Probabilistic Traveling Salesman Problem by the ACO Metaheuristic

Result.Abstract: In this paper, we review half a century of research on the design of systems displaying (physical) self-assembly of macroscopic components. We report on the experience gained in the design of 21 such systems, exhibiting components ranging from passive mechanical parts to mobile robots. We present a taxonomy of the systems and discuss design principles and functions. Finally, we summarize
Result.Title: Self-Assembly at the Macroscopic Scale
